title.native: 荒野のコトブキ飛行隊

description:
The story takes place in a barren frontier where people trade goods with each other in order to help each other survive. The Kotobuki Squadron are bodyguards for hire, led by a strict but beautiful squadron leader, an unreliable commanding officer, and a true artisan of a crew chief. Alongside pilots who don't lack for personality, they take to the air in dogfights, letting the engine noise of their Hayabusa fighters ring out in the skies.

(Source: Anime News Network)

**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GODDOOR1967) | [Website](http://www.ne.jp/asahi/sky/road/)

Often goes by one of his many pseudonyms.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/115874632) | [Website](leftside.info/index.html)

Hidari is a Japanese illustrator and character designer. He is primarily known as an illustrator for video games and light novels. Some of his notable designs for anime include [Fractale](https://anilist.co/anime/9314/) and [Natsuiro Kiseki](https://anilist.co/anime/12119/) and for PS3 game Atelier Ayesha, and best known light novel illustrations are for [Sasami-san@Ganbaranai](https://anilist.co/manga/69349/).

His pseudonym and circle "Left Side" comes from the fact that he predominantly uses his left hand.

He was awarded third place in the 2010 “Kono Light Novel ga Sugoi!” illustrator ranking.

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Dusk (Video Game, 2012) (Character Illustration / Character Designing, Illustration)
- Atelier Escha & Logy: Alchemists of the Dusk Sky (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Designing)
- Atelier Shallie: Alchemists of the Dusk Sea (Video Game, 2014) (Character Illustration / Character Designing)
- Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia (Video Game, 2017) (Character Design & Illustration)
- Record of Lodoss War: Deedlit in Wonder Labyrinth (Video Game, 2020) (Character Drafts)

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/romanovh) | [Hatena Blog](https://romanovhiga.hateblo.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/418723) | [note](https://note.com/romanovh/)

Romanov Higa, born Kazuhiro Higa, is one of the leading 3DCG animation artists in Japan. He graduated The University of Electro-Communications in Tokyo, Japan in 1996.

In 1997, his work "ONE DAY, SOME GIRL" won the Grand Prix at the 9th Amateur CG Animation Contest organized by Project Team DoGA. In 1999, he joined video game publisher Namco, but left only a few years later in 2001. He then started working freelance, mostly working on his own original movies. In recent years, his work has mostly been either storyboarding or within the art department of video games, and have notably been working on several titles in the *Pokémon* franchise.

**Non-Anime work:**
~!**Gungrave** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, some interludes)
**Galaxy Angel** (VG: Windows, PS2, Xbox) - Movie Production (Beginning scene)
**Gungrave OD** (VG: PS2) - Movie Direction, Storyboard, Production (OP, ED, interludes)
**Princess Holiday ~Korogaru Ringotei Sen'ya Ichiya~** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tsuki wa Higashi ni Hi wa Nishi ni ~Operation Sanctuary~** (VG: Dreamcast, PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: Dreamcast) - Direction, Storyboard, Production (Intermission movies)
**BALDR FORCE EXE** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Tenkabito** (VG: PS2) - Storyboard (Interlude movie)
**BALDR BULLET EQUILIBRIUM** (VG: PS2) - Unit Director, Producer (Advertising movie)
**Pokémon Sun & Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design
**Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon** (VG: 3DS) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphics
**Pokémon Let's Go, Pikachu! & Let's Go, Eevee!** (VG: Switch) - Storyboard Design, Scenario Movie Graphic Design
**Pokémon Sword & Shield** (VG: Switch) - Movie Graphic Design
**New Pokémon Snap** (VG: Switch) - Movie Direction
**Pokémon Legends: Arceus** (VG: Switch) - Cinematic Design Team!~

She was a former AKB48 member (Team A) who graduated from the group on February 6th, 2013 to concentrate on her career as a seiyuu

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/278548957) | [Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/mizshima1941)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hibiku_yamamura)

[Profile](http://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/tomita_miyu/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miyu-tomita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyju_tomita) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomita__miyu._/)

The Grand Prix winner of the 2014 Seiyuu Artist Training Program Selection competition, which was sponsored by Amuse and Ken Production. After being scouted by six talent agencies, she eventually joined Amuse.

She made her voice acting debut in 2015, voicing a number of unnamed characters in Himouto Umaru-chan.

Non-Anime Roles
• Layla - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Zara - Memento Mori (VG)
• New Jersey - Azur Lane (VG)
• Jiu Niangzi - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
Handles international coordination for dubs.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.
